1.goal: Make a Simple Inside Windshield Cleaner
steps: Purchase a blackboard eraser.
Keep the blackboard eraser in the glove box or attach it to a spot on or near the car door for easy access.
Use the eraser to clean the inner side of the windshield.
Replace after use.

6.goal: Get a Headshot in Gears of War
steps: Sniper — Simply aim at the head and pull the trigger, unless you're the host, in which case you will need to aim in front of where they're going.
Shotgun — The aim on the shotgun is almost like a rectangle.
Pistol — I'm not sure because I haven't played in a while, but it's either six or seven shots to the head with the standard-issue pistol for a headshot.
BoomShot — BoomShot headshots are possible — don't let anyone tell you they're not but the chance of one happening is about a million to one.

step2.local_salience_explanation:
Sure! Here are the ingredients for the marshmallow cream cheese dip recipe:

* 1 block of cream cheese (8 ounces)
* 1/2 cup of marshmallow creme
* 1/2 cup of sour cream
* 1 tablespoon of vanilla extract
* 1/4 cup of powdered sugar
* 1/4 teaspoon of salt
* 1/2 cup of chopped fruit (such as strawberries, blueberries, or raspberries) (optional)

You'll also need a mixing bowl and a spoon or electric mixer to mix the ingredients together. If you want to serve the dip with fruit, you'll need a fruit platter or skewers as well.

Sure, here are some tips for getting a good grip on a bike:

1. Make sure your hands are dry: Sweaty hands can make it difficult to get a good grip on the bike's handlebars. If your hands are wet, wipe them dry with a towel before riding.
2. Adjust the handlebars: Make sure the handlebars are at a comfortable height and position for your body. This will help you maintain a good grip and prevent strain on your back and shoulders.
3. Use the correct hand position: Hold the handlebars with your hands in the correct position, with your palms facing down and your fingers wrapped around the bars. This will give you a secure grip and help you maintain control of the bike.
4. Keep your grip light: Don't grip the handlebars too tightly, as this can cause fatigue and discomfort. Instead, keep your grip light and relaxed, with your fingers and thumb wrapped around the bars.
5. Use gloves: Wearing gloves can help improve your grip on the bike's handlebars. Look for gloves with padding on the palms and fingers to help absorb shock and provide a better grip.
6. Practice your grip: If you're having trouble getting a good grip on the bike, practice holding the handlebars in different positions and with different grip styles. This will help you find a grip that feels comfortable and secure for you.

By following these tips, you should be able to get a good grip on your bike and enjoy a safe and comfortable ride.

states.global_salience_explanation:
Handbrakes are an essential component of a bicycle, allowing the rider to slow down or stop the bike quickly and safely. Here are some tips for using handbrakes effectively:

1. Familiarize yourself with the location and function of the handbrakes: Before you start riding, make sure you know where the handbrakes are located and how to use them. Practice squeezing the brake levers and feeling for the brake pads to engage.
2. Use the correct braking technique: To use the handbrakes effectively, you need to use the correct braking technique. This means squeezing the brake levers gradually and smoothly, applying even pressure to both brakes at the same time. Avoid sudden, hard braking, as this can cause the bike to skid or lose control.
3. Practice braking on different terrain: Practice braking on different types of terrain, such as flat roads, hills, and corners, to get a feel for how the bike responds to braking in different situations. This will help you develop your braking skills and increase your confidence.
4. Use the handbrakes in combination with the pedals: When braking, use the handbrakes in combination with the pedals to slow down the bike. This will help you maintain control and balance, and avoid skidding or losing traction.
5. Check the brakes regularly: Make sure to check the brakes regularly to ensure they are functioning properly. Check the brake pads for wear, and adjust the brake cables as needed. Properly maintained brakes will help you ride safely and confidently.

By following these tips, you can use your handbrakes effectively and safely, allowing you to ride with confidence and control. Remember, practice makes perfect, so keep practicing your braking skills to become a more confident and competent rider.

steps: Prefer boarding across a solid platform if possible.

Once in the boat, always remain in the centre line to move around it and lower yourself to a crouch level so that you reduce your centre of gravity and keep the craft as still as possible.
Keep the craft steady as others board.

step1.local_salience_explanation:
Gravity is a fundamental force of nature that causes objects with mass to attract each other. It is the force that keeps planets in orbit around their stars, causes objects to fall towards the ground, and holds galaxies together.

The concept of gravity has been understood for thousands of years, with ancient civilizations recognizing that objects have a tendency to fall towards the ground. However, it was not until the work of Sir Isaac Newton in the 17th century that the fundamental laws of gravity were first described.

Newton's law of universal gravitation states that every point mass attracts every other point mass with a force proportional to the product of their masses and inversely proportional to the square of the distance between them. This law applies to all objects with mass, from the smallest subatomic particles to the largest galaxies.

In the 20th century, Albert Einstein developed the theory of general relativity, which describes gravity as the curvature of spacetime caused by the presence of mass and energy. According to this theory, gravity is not a force that acts between objects, but rather a consequence of the geometry of spacetime.

Gravity plays a vital role in many fields, including astrophysics, geology, and engineering. It is used to study the structure and evolution of the universe, to understand the behavior of planets and stars, and to design and build structures such as bridges and skyscrapers.

Despite its importance, gravity remains a mysterious force, with many unanswered questions about its nature and behavior. Scientists continue to study gravity, using experiments and observations to better understand its effects and to develop new technologies that exploit its power.

Some of the most fascinating aspects of gravity include:

1. Gravitational waves: These are ripples in spacetime that are produced by the movement of massive objects, such as black holes or neutron stars. They were predicted by Einstein's theory of general relativity and were first detected in 2015 by the Laser Interferometer Gravitational-Wave Observatory (LIGO).

26.goal: Make a Wreath with Clothes Hangers
steps: Untwist wire hanger and shape into a circle, using pliers as needed.
Gently crumple 3" squares of wax paper or crepe paper and thread hanger through center of each square.
When you have threaded enough squares to fill length of hanger, gently push squares away from ends and use pliers to twist ends together.
Gently slide squares of paper back toward the joined ends of wire hanger, scrunching paper more for additional fullness.
Finished.

steps: Preheat your oven beforehand to 400°F (200°C or Gas Mark 6).
Add your olive oil into a baking or roasting tin large enough to hold all of your asparagus spears.
Cut off the ends of the asparagus spears and wrap enough Serrano ham around each asparagus spear until it is mostly covered but with top jagged part still open.
Roast the asparagus in the oven for 8-10 minutes.
Serve immediately with a main dish so your asparagus acts as a side order.

5. Tracing paper (1/5): Tracing paper is a thin, translucent paper that can be used to soften the light, but it may not be as effective as other methods.

38.goal: Change the Oil on a Yamaha Virago XV250
steps: Remove the bung to let the oil out to drain.
Remove the oil cap to let the oil drain fully and let air in to help drain the old oil out.
Remove the oil filter.
Screw the bung back on.
Fill the oil back up.
Recycle the old oil.

steps: Take one roll of duct tape and make a piece about a little bigger than your head.
Measure it around your head, and cut it off the roll.
Fold it halfway through the middle, like shown.
Fold the other half so there is no sticky part showing.
Tape the ends together.
And you are done!

step6.local_salience_explanation:
Sure, here are some possible extracts that could be used in the production of pineapple sherbet:

1. Pineapple juice: This is the most obvious extract to use in pineapple sherbet, as it provides the fruit's signature flavor and aroma. Fresh pineapple juice can be used, or a concentrated juice can be diluted with water to create a sweeter flavor.
2. Pineapple puree: A pineapple puree can be made by blending fresh pineapple chunks with a little bit of water to create a smooth, creamy texture. This puree can be used as a base for the sherbet, providing a rich, fruity flavor.
3. Pineapple extract: A pineapple extract can be made by mixing pineapple juice with a small amount of alcohol, such as vodka or rum, and then letting it sit for a few days to allow the flavors to meld together. This extract can be used to add a concentrated pineapple flavor to the sherbet.
4. Pineapple syrup: A pineapple syrup can be made by boiling pineapple juice with sugar and a little bit of water until it thickens into a syrup. This syrup can be used to sweeten the sherbet and add a touch of pineapple flavor.
5. Pineapple zest: The zest of a pineapple can be grated and added to the sherbet to provide a subtle, citrusy flavor. This can be done by grating the zest directly into the sherbet mixture or by infusing the zest into a simple syrup before adding it to the sherbet.

These are just a few examples of the types of extracts that could be used in pineapple sherbet. The exact extract used will depend on personal preference and the desired intensity of the pineapple flavor.

3. Bucket: A bucket is useful for containing the solvent and paint scraper, as well as for rinsing and disposing of the paint.
4. Sponge or cloth: A sponge or cloth can be used to clean up splatters and excess paint.
5. Gloves: Wearing gloves can protect your hands from the solvent and paint.
6. Safety glasses: Safety glasses can protect your eyes from splatters and other hazards.
7. Paintbrush or roller: If you're using a solvent to remove the paint, you may need a paintbrush or roller to apply the solvent to the paint.
8. Sandpaper or steel wool: If the paint is particularly stubborn, you may need to use sandpaper or steel wool to roughen up the surface and help the solvent penetrate.
9. Clean water: Clean water is needed to rinse the solvent and paint off the window.
10. Cleaning supplies: You may need additional cleaning supplies, such as soap and a scrub brush, to clean the window after removing the paint.

It's important to note that the specific items you'll need may vary depending on the type of paint and the surface you're working with. Be sure to read the instructions on any chemicals you use and take appropriate safety precautions.

52.goal: Use a Mic in Team Fortress 2
steps: Make sure that your microphone is working and connected first.
Find various panels at the top like "Multiplayer", "Mouse", "Audio", etc.
Click on the Voice panel.
Start talking with other players using your microphone!
Use the microphone to communicate with your team in a more efficient manner and demand that your voice is heard!
Advise teammates as well as make game plans to help and support your team.

53.goal: Make Chinese Macaroni in Just 20 Minutes
steps: Boil macaroni in hot boiling water with some salt and oil for 10-15 minutes.
After the macaroni has boiled put under running water for about 15 seconds to prevent over cooking.
In another pan add some oil and toss in the macaroni.
Add salt, red chilli powder ,soy sauce,white vinegar and ajino moto.
Cook for some seconds.
Serve hot with chilled drinks.

Finished.
